newsitem.title: USA: Harbinger buys SupplyTech for $50.8 million.
newsitem.headline: Harbinger buys SupplyTech for $50.8 million.

text.p: Harbinger Corp. said Monday it bought SupplyTech Inc. in stock deal worth about $50.8 million, making it North America's second-largest independent supplier of software used in electronic commerce.

Under the agreement, Harbinger will issue 1.6 million new common shares in exchange for full control of SupplyTech in a pooling of interests. Harbinger said it will have 13.5 million fully diluted shares outstanding after the issue.
Harbinger's stock surged $4.125 to $31.75 early on Nasdaq.
Atlanta-based Harbinger said it will take a first-quarter charge of $7.5 million to $10 million for the acquisition, which is expected to boost 1997 earnings.
SupplyTech, a private company based in Ann Arbor, Mich., also supplies electronic commerce software to connect large companies with their suppliers, trading partners and customers.
The combined companies had more than $60 million in revenue for the year ended Dec. 31, Harbinger said.
